package.name: particle-filter-ros2
package.description:
Particle Filter MCL for TurtleBot3 with heading alignment corrections.
SETUP: 1. Build: colcon build --packages-select particle-filter-ros2 2. Source: source install/setup.bash
RUNNING THE PARTICLE FILTER: Terminal 1 (Gazebo + RViz): ros2 launch particle-filter-ros2 particle_filter.launch.py
Terminal 2 (Particle Filter Node): ros2 run particle-filter-ros2 particle_filter
Terminal 3 (Teleop Control): ros2 run turtlebot3_teleop teleop_keyboard
RVIZ CONFIGURATION: - Add PoseArray display for /particlecloud * Set "Displacement" (not Position) to visualize particle headings - Add PoseWithCovarianceStamped display for /amcl_pose * Set "Displacement" (not Position) to visualize estimated pose - Both should align with robot heading when converged
KEY PARAMETERS (config/pf.yaml): - num_particles: 5000 (covers entire map initially) - laser_offset_angle: 3.14159 (180Â° - laser mounted backward) - z_hit: 0.95, z_rand: 0.05 (aggressive heading discrimination) - sigma_hit: 0.05 (tight sensor tolerance) - alpha1-4: 0.01 (follow odometry closely)
EXPECTED BEHAVIOR: - Particles initially spread across entire map - After 1st scan: Converge to robot position - After 2nd scan: Align with robot heading - Result: Particles point same direction as robot
